title: Upload container images to a registry (OpenShift)
content:
Upload the installation images to your image registry. The image registry is a local registry on your cluster nodes or an external registry, such as your enterprise repository.

To upload the images:

  1. Log on to the bastion node where you downloaded or copied the images.
  2. Run the following command to the $CDF_HOME/scripts/ directory: 
    cd $CDF_HOME/scripts
  3. Run the following command to upload the suite images to the local registry: 
    ./uploadimages.sh [-r <image repository URL> -u <username> -d <image download directory> -o <org name>]

    Where,

    <image repository URL>: Specify the -r option if you want to upload the images to an external registry other than the local registry.

    Replace <username> with the registry username. Use the registry-admin user for the local registry. The local registry refers to the default registry or the registry URL that's localhost:5000.

    If you don't specify the credentials here, you can specify when prompted while running the command.

    <image download directory>: The directory where the container images will get downloaded. The default value is /var/opt/cdf/offline. The -d option is the image directory where you placed the images you have downloaded. Specify the -d option if the images aren't available in the /var/opt/cdf/offline/ directory. You can use the -d option multiple times when the images are in different directories. However, if you have specified the -l option to "false", then you can only specify one image directory. The images can be the images download by the downloadimages.sh. Only the .tar, .tgz, and .tar.gz images are supported. Make sure the image file type matches the file extension. 

    <org name>: The organization in the image registry that contains the images for installation. By default, this is hpeswitom. This option is mandatory if you aren't using the default organization name.

    To see the full list of options for the uploadimages.sh command, run the following command: 
    ./uploadimages.sh -h
    For example: 
    ./uploadimages.sh -y -c 4 -u registry-admin


    The -p option is the password of the registry-admin user. The initial value of the registry-admin password is the password you set while you run the install to install OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT). You can also change the registry-admin password with the script $CDF_HOME/scripts/updateLocalRegistryInfo.sh.

    Note
    By selecting the -p option, you are disabling or bypassing security features, thereby exposing the system to increased security risks. By using this option, you understand and agree to assume all associated risks and hold OpenText harmless for the same.
    OpenText encourages you to use some other password options, which aren't provided by OpenText. By implementing the -p option, you may expose the system to increased security risks. You understand and agree to assume all associated risks and hold OpenText harmless for the same. It remains at all times your sole responsibility to assess its own regulatory and business requirements.   4. Wait until the images are successfully uploaded. Your terminal resembles the following: 
    Upload-process successfully completed.
